result.execSummary:
The defendant Shadayva Ann Harman was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 2nd-Degree Recklessly Endangering Safety [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.30(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Set at $775.00 payable to Davonte M., to be collected by DOC from the defendant's prison funds and from other monies held in the defendant's inmate account; an amount or percentage which the Dept. determines is reasonable for restitution to victims and during term of Extended Supervision; non-payment penalty shall be a civil judgment.

Provide a DNA sample; pay the related surcharge. Pay court costs and all applicable assessments to be collected by DOC, at a rate the Dept. determines is reasonable, from the defendant's funds held in the defendant's inmate account and during term of Extended Supervision; non-payment penalty shall be a civil judgment.
- Pay supervision fees.
- Extradition fees in the amount of $104.67 to be included in costs and payable to District Attorney's Office.

07-07-2020/ Judge T Christopher Dee
The Court ordered that the JOC shall be amended to include a total of 501  days of sentence credit .

superMiscConds.notes:
- No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause.
- NO CONTACT with Davonte M.
- No alcohol or illgal drugs.
- No prescription medications without a valid prescription.

- Cooperate with any correctional programs recommended.
- Follow all rules of extended supervision.

- AODA assessment and any recommended treatment.
- Random urine screens.

supervisions.notes: Court advised that as a convicted felon, defendant may not possess firearms/body armors and cannot vote until her voting rights are restored.

records.addlTxt:
Statements by parties.

AS TO COUNT 1: The Court sentenced defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons for 9 YEARS.  INITIAL CONFINEMENT of 5 YEARS and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 4 YEARS, with credit for 489 days time served.

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:
-Defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and is not eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.
-Restitution set at $775.00 payable to Davonte M., to be collected by DOC from the defendant's prison funds and from other monies held in the defendant's inmate account; an amount or percentage which the department determines is reasonable for restitution to victims and during term of extended supervision; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment
-Extradition fees in the amount of $104.67 to be included in costs and payable to the District Attorney's office to be collected by DOC, at a rate the department determines is reasonable, from defendant's funds held in the defendant's inmate account and during term of extended supervision; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment
-Defendant to pay Court costs and all applicable assessments to be collected by DOC, at a rate the department determines is reasonable, from defendant's funds held in the defendant's inmate account and during term of extended supervision; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment
-Defendant is to provide a DNA sample and pay the related surcharge to be collected by DOC, at a rate the department determines is reasonable, from the defendant's funds held in the defendant's inmate account and during term of extended supervision; nonpayment penalty shall result in a civil judgment 
-No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause
-Cooperate with any correctional programs recommended
-Follow all rules of extended supervision
-Pay all supervision fees 
-Obtain/maintain employment  
-No contact with victim Davonte M.
-AODA assessment and any recommended treatment
-Random urine screens
-No alcohol or illegal drugs 
-No prescription medications without a valid prescription

Court further advised that as a convicted felon, defendant may not possess firearms/body armors and cannot vote until her voting rights are restored.
State advised they will be filing further extradition fees within 7 (SEVEN) days of today's sentencing date.

Telephone call received from Attorney Plaisted indicating that his client wants to withdraw her guilty plea.  Sentencing date converted to Motion to Withdraw date.

Defendant Shadayva Ann Harman in court with attorney Michael B Plaisted.  Defendant Shadayva Ann Harman in custody.  Thomas L. Potter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Pursuant to plea negotiations, and on motion of the State, Court ordered the penality enhancer STRIKEN and COUNT 2 DISMISSED to be used as a READ-IN on COUNT 1.  Defendant changes plea to NO CONTEST.  Defendant examined as to her plea, advised of her Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived her rights. Plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon she may no longer use or possess any firearms; also she may not vote in any election until her civil rights have been restored.  Court further advised that if she is not a US citizen, deportation is possible.  Court ordered defendant remanded into the custody of the Sheriff's Department pending sentencing.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for January 2, 2019 at 08:30 am.
